quiz.title: Pre-calculus: Unit 1 Quiz 9
quiz.subtitle: 1.9: Complex Numbers and Operations
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: The imaginary unit, operations with complex numbers, and conjugates

questions.question: What is the value of $i^2$?
questions.explanation: By definition, the square of the imaginary unit $i$ is $-1$.

questions.question: Perform the operation: $(3 + 4i) + (2 - 6i)$
questions.explanation: Add the real parts ($3+2=5$) and the imaginary parts ($4i - 6i = -2i$).

questions.question: Multiply: $(2 + i)(3 - i)$
questions.explanation: FOIL: $6 - 2i + 3i - i^2$. Since $i^2 = -1$, this becomes $6 + i - (-1) = 7 + i$.

questions.question: What is the complex conjugate of $-3 + 5i$?
questions.explanation: The complex conjugate of $a + bi$ is $a - bi$. Only the sign of the imaginary part changes.

questions.question: Simplify $i^{10}$.
questions.explanation: Divide the exponent by 4: $10 \div 4 = 2$ with a remainder of 2. $i^{10}$ is equivalent to $i^2$, which is $-1$.

questions.question: Solve the equation $x^2 + 25 = 0$ over the complex numbers.
What is the result of multiplying a complex number by its conjugate $(a + bi)(a - bi)$?
questions.explanation: FOILing gives $a^2 - abi + abi - b^2i^2$. This simplifies to $a^2 - b^2(-1) = a^2 + b^2$ (always a real number).

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You have a great imagination (and mastery of complex numbers).
scoreMessages.70: Good job. Remember that $i^2$ must always be converted to $-1$.
scoreMessages.50: Watch your signs when FOILing complex binomials.
scoreMessages.0: Review the definition of $i$ and the pattern of its powers.
